entry.title: Design System Development
entry.content:
Overview

The company had three different channels for conducting business. Retail, Consumer-direct, and wholesale. B2C, retail, and consumer-direct part of the company had multiple subsidiaries that required different branding. Similarly, wholesale customers wanted to apply their own branding to our provided services as well.

Another issue with their proprietary system was front-end development speed. There were no guidelines nor component library for repetitive items, even for a button. Every button on different pages was slightly different.

Color Tokens
Typography Tokens

Primitive Tokens

Based on our products’ needs and goals, I set up various tokens. As we were not using semantic tokens at the moment, the color palettes itself are following WCAG 2.0 (and 3.0 for orange tone) to deal with any kind of scenarios.

Typography token is using 3 different primitive tokens, font size, font weight, and line height. By doing this, each theme can be easily controlled for its purpose.

Token Naming Convention
Semantic Token Hierarchy

Component & Semantic Tokens

Figma didn’t have a native way to apply tokens properly but with limited library features. I was able to make a decent way to apply different themes with library swap feature, but it was still, too much to ask new designers who are not familiar with Figma.

Thankfully, Figma introduced variable feature. And I was able to update all the components with it quickly.

While making and applying component tokens, I realized two things; In code, token naming convention is not consistent It’s a good time to apply Semantic Tokens.

I grabbed front-end engineers and showed possible two naming conventions, and suggestions for applying semantic tokens for actions. Thanks to the great front-end engineering team, we connected Figma tokens to the code. Figma token update means code is updated automatically.

Product for Our Team

I believe making a design system is making a product for designers and software engineers. So I did everything I could to make it convenient for them. Slot and table component is some of the my efforts to make that possible.

With Slot component, designers could update the contents inside of a component without disconnecting its library. (slot component concept is originally from Atlassian. See Atlassian Figma File)

Working on a financial product meant a lot of tables. (or a similar structure) Designers always needed to spend lots of time moving around table borders, cells, rows, and columns. After the update, designers never needed to work more than 5 minutes on any kind of updates for tables.

entry.title: Mortgage Application Design
entry.content:
Overview

Based on research on the existing product, its customers, other products from competitors, and mortgage rules and regulations, I suggested two different approaches. Updating visuals with minimal changes and overhauling the application. The stakeholders wanted to go with a fast way, updating visuals.

Even though it was a visual update, I believed there would be some room and opportunities to make general UX better. I threw a presentation about some opportunities that can improve the product while updating visuals.

Information Hierarchy

Even though the originating system that was connected to the product had certain items in the same group, the product didn’t need to follow the same grouping rule. There was a consumer report including a review of this product which states navigating issues.

I broke down the Uniform Residential Loan Application, URLA, into several parts along with other competitors and ours. The flow chart was shared with any new project contributors for an easy and quick overview.

Boring, long, mandatory questionaries in the old product
Distributed in multiple "related" pages
Data entry forms can be easier for users. I grouped in multiple different ways to find the best way
After several conversations with stakeholders, long list of dropdown menu became this

Funnel type of data entry

I have been exposed enough to understand several regulations regarding the mortgage application and some marketing techniques. Combining these two into one, I suggested gathering estimated information is better than capturing the precise information upfront.

TRID rule requires lenders to provide loan estimates and closing disclosures to the borrower within 3 business days. The timer starts clocking once the borrower provides certain information. However, lenders easily guess some values of that information.

Instead of doing that, I suggested separate data entry into two parts, assigning easy and attracting ones up-front and complicated and time consuming ones later, in another existing product, borrower portal.

entry.title: at Cardinal Financial
entry.content:
Overview

I also led the development of a comprehensive design system that emphasized theming and a precise connection between design and code, which was utilized across five different products.

My efforts in fostering a supportive environment not only significantly reduced unnecessary tasks and Figma-related inquiries but also led to the expansion of the team with three additional UX designers.

Additionally, I served as an internal UX consultant for various features in proprietary loan origination system. Providing essential research, guidance, prototypes, and conceptual designs, contributed in the company's approach to user experience design.

Designer Workshop

I started bi-weekly designer only meetings to share thoughts and knowledges, created a Zoom channel to make new designers feel comfortable and confident about what they are doing and to align our UX experience voice as a team.

Figma quick guide for FE Engineers
Advanced prototyping tutorial for Designers

Figma Admin and Guide

Established Figma file organizing rule. Using Asana widget on the cover of a file, viewers can check the feature's progress and connect it to its related links. A better naming convention in the library helped designers with faster and more accurate search. Provided multiple guides for designers and engineers.

Slot in Figma tutorial
Checkbox prototype tutorial
Timer prototype tutorial

Other UX Related Support

Numerous proprietary loan origination system UX consultations with concept designs, accessible color palette for multiple products, UX research on our & competitor products.

entry.title: at RMK
entry.content:
Overview

  • Design Components and UI/UX Design for Proprietary web LOS
  • UI/UX Design for Public Websites and Landing Pages
  • automation with RPA

    • The company was highly focused on the wholesale mortgage industry. I interacted with internal account executives and signed up brokers to enhance their overall experiences with the website and the company's services.

    As a sole UI/UX designer, I actively looked for issues in the proprietary LOS and suggested multiple solutions to the stakeholders directly, including CEO.

    CFPB regulations were always considered while creating designs for public and marketing materials which made faster communication and easy approval possible with the internal compliance team.

    After understanding more about the mortgage industry and our customers' needs, I was able to participate in the development of mortgage programs such as Non-QM DSCR.

    LOS Interface Update with Design System
